data.title: Clash of Code Database
data.solution:
n = int(input())
l = int(input())
p = 1.0
d = 1
while p > 0.5:
    n += l
    p *= (n - d) / n
    d += 1
print(d)
data.statement:
You like playing Clash of Code, but some of the players are so incredibly fast that they must have a database from which they can retrieve their solutions! You started building your own, but so far you never encountered a Clash that you already know. Their number must be infinite! But in case it is not, you're determined to figure out your odds of encountering a known clash, taking inspiration from the birthday paradox.

There were [[N]] clashes in CodinGame's database when you finished introduction path and played your first clash (day 1). Because you have a demanding job, wife and dog, you can only play <<one clash per day>>.  However, Lisa has many ideas and [[L]] new clashes are <<added per day>>.

Print the number of days for which you have to clash until you will have encountered a known clash with a probability of 50% or more.

<<Math hints:>>
- The probability [[q]] to encounter at least one clash more than once is 1 - [[p]], where [[p]] is the probability to encounter only different clashes on the days 1 ... [[d]]. 
- Here we assume clashes are drawn independently each day from the database, so [[p]] = [[p1]] * [[p2]] * ... * [[pd]]
- The probability to encounter one of the unknown clashes on any given day is [[U]]/[[T]], where [[U]] is the number of unknown clashes (on that day) and [[T]] is the total number of clashes in the database (on that day).

Good luck!

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You like playing Clash of Code, but some of the players are so incredibly fast that they must have a database from which they can retrieve their solutions! You started building your own, but so far you never encountered a Clash that you already know. Their number must be infinite! But in case it is not, you're determined to figure out your odds of encountering a known clash, taking inspiration from the birthday paradox.

There were N clashes in CodinGame's database when you finished introduction path and played your first clash (day 1). Because you have a demanding job, wife and dog, you can only play one clash per day. However, Lisa has many ideas and L new clashes are added per day.

Print the number of days for which you have to clash until you will have encountered a known clash with a probability of 50% or more.

Math hints:
- The probability q to encounter at least one clash more than once is 1 - p, where p is the probability to encounter only different clashes on the days 1 ... d.
- Here we assume clashes are drawn independently each day from the database, so p = p1 * p2 * ... * pd
- The probability to encounter one of the unknown clashes on any given day is U/T, where U is the number of unknown clashes (on that day) and T is the total number of clashes in the database (on that day).

Good luck!
Input
First line: An integer N for the number of clashes in CodinGame's database on day 1.
Second line: An integer L for the number of clashes added to CodinGame's database per day.
Output
One line: The number of days for which you have to clash, so that you will have encountered a clash more than once with at least 50% probability.
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 10000
0 ≤ L ≤ 100
Example
Input
365
0
Output
23
